info.game_comments: Game data retrieved from an alternate archive.

(1, 1).clue: The discovery of this in California on Jan. 24, 1848 was kept quiet until the N.Y. Herald ran the news in August

(3, 1).clue: That erupting volcano is no mirage--you're at The Mirage in this city

(5, 1).clue: Proverbially, this animal keeps getting its back broken by one straw too many

(6, 1).clue: It's the title of an unmarried woman who is the chief attendant of a bride

(6, 5).clue: A lawyer may ask for this, a legal term meaning the movement of a trial to another location

(1, 1).clue: (Video of Sarah in Toledo, Spain.) Windmills, like this one, inspired perhaps the most famous scene in all this writer's work

(2, 1).clue: At Ikea, Gulliver is a crib & Gok is this kind of table where a crying baby might go from the crib

(3, 1).clue: He set up his brother Joseph as ruler of Naples & his brother Louis as King of Holland

(4, 2).clue: Luke's symbol; unlike lumberjack Bunyan's, his is winged, not blue
